sentences.sentence: The Lion, the Bear, and the Fox( 狐狸 )
A lion and a bear both caught a goat( 山羊 ) at the same moment, and fought for who would keep it.
After a long and exhausting fight, they both lay down seriously hurt.
A fox( 狐狸 ), who was watching them from a distance, saw them both lying on the ground, and the goat( 山羊 ) lying untouched in the middle.
He ran between them, took the goat( 山羊 ), and ran off( 逃跑 ) as fast as he could.
The lion and the bear saw him, but couldn’t get up, and said,
“It’s a pity that we fought and hurt each other only to help a fox( 狐狸 )!”
MORAL: If you must fight for something, make sure you keep your eyes on the prize.
The Lion, the Donkey( 驴 ) and the Fox( 狐狸 ) Go Hunting( 捕猎 )
A lion, a donkey( 驴 ) and a fox( 狐狸 ) formed a group to go out hunting( 捕猎 ).
They caught many animals, and thought of having a big meal.
The lion then asked the donkey( 驴 ) to divide up( 分配 ) the food.
Sharing it into three equal parts, the donkey( 驴 ) asked his friends to make their choice.
The lion angrily jumped on the donkey( 驴 ) and ate him.
He then asked the fox( 狐狸 ) to divide up( 分配 ) the food.
The fox( 狐狸 ) put most of the food into one big heap( 堆 ), and just kept a little for himself.
“Ah! Friend,” said the lion, “who taught you to share up( 分配 ) food like that?”
“The donkey( 驴 ) did”, replied the fox( 狐狸 ).
MORAL: Better to learn from the mistakes of others than from your own.
The Lion, the Wolf( 狼 ), and the Fox( 狐狸 )
A lion, growing old, lay sick in his cave( 洞穴 ).
All the beasts( 野兽 ) came to visit their king, except the fox( 狐狸 ).
The wolf( 狼 ) saw a good opportunity of getting rid of( 除去 ) his enemy, the fox( 狐狸 ).
So, in front of the lion, he accused( 指责 ) the fox( 狐狸 ) of not paying any respect to the ruler of all the animals,
and also of not coming to visit him.
At that very moment, the fox( 狐狸 ) came in and heard these last words of the wolf( 狼 ).
The lion was very angry with the fox( 狐狸 ), but the fox( 狐狸 ) said,
“I have traveled all over the world and I’ve found out from the doctors the best way to cure( 治愈 ) you.”
The lion ordered him immediately to tell him the cure( 治疗方法 ), and he replied,
“You must cut all the skin off a wolf( 狼 ) while he is still alive, and wrap( 用...包裹 ) his skin round you while it is still warm.”
The wolf( 狼 ) was at once taken and all his skin was cut off him.
The fox( 狐狸 ), turning to him, said with a smile,
“Your big mistake was to make your master( 主人 ) feel anger, not kindness.”
MORAL: There is always a better liar than you.
A Man and His Dog
A man’s dog fell into a deep well, and the man went down on a rope to save his dog.
He reached down several times to grab( 抓住 ) the dog and pull it up( 向上拉 ),
but each time, the dog just bit his fingers.
So finally the man climbed back up and left the dog, saying,
“Why should I suffer( 遭受 ) so much pain to help one who refuses to be helped?”
MORAL: Don’t hurt those who try to help you.

article_info.previous: 在昨天的故事里，由狐狸，豺狼，狼和狮子组成的狩猎团队，捕捉到一头鹿后，狮子独吞了狩猎成果。这个故事告诉我们，很多时候，实力才是决定成果分配的标准，你可能参与了工作，但是分享不到成果。
article_info.share_words: If you must fight for something, make sure you keep your eyes on the prize.  Don’t hurt those who try to help you.

question.cn: 在故事The Lion, the Bear and the Fox中，谁最终得到了山羊？
question.en: In the end of the story The Lion, the Bear and the Fox, who got the goat?

analysis: 文中提到：“A fox… he ran between them, took the goat, and ran off as fast as he could.”可知，最后在狮子和熊两败俱伤之际，狐狸偷走了山羊，因此选C。

question.cn: 在故事the Lion, the Donkey and the Fox Go Hunting 中，狐狸给自己留了多少食物？
question.en: In the story the Lion, the Donkey and the Fox Go Hunting, how much food did the fox keep for himself？

options.cn: 他留的食物和狮子一样多。
options.en: He kept the same food as the lion's.
He kept more food than the lion's.
He kept much less food than the lion.'s

analysis: 文中提到：“The fox put most of the food into one big heap, and just kept a little for himself.”因此选C。

question.cn: 在故事The Lion, the Wolf, and the Fox中，谁想除掉狐狸？
question.en: In the story the Lion, the Wolf, and the Fox, who wanted to get rid of the fox?

analysis: 文中提到：“The wolf saw a good opportunity of getting rid of his enemy, the fox.”因此，想除掉狐狸的是狼，因此选B。

question.cn: 在故事The Lion, the Wolf, and the Fox中，狐狸认为，狼犯的错误是什么？
question.en: In the story the Lion, the Wolf, and the Fox, according to the fox, what was the wolf's mistake?

options.en: He made the lion feel guilty.

analysis: 文中提到：“The fox, turning to him, said with a smile, ‘Your big mistake was to make your master feel anger, not kindness.’”因此选A。

question.cn: 在故事A Man and His Dog中，我们知道了关于狗的什么信息？
question.en: In the story of A Man and His Dog, what did we know about the dog?

options.en: The dog accepted his master's aid.
The dog refused his master's aid.

analysis: 文中提到：“Why should I suffer so much pain to help one who refuses to be helped?”可知，狗拒绝了主人的帮助，因此选B。

share_title: 100天读完3本英文书，今天是第19天
